resources.string: Lupine Observations
Defeat Fangsnap in Fangsnap's Den for Survivalist Wilson in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"What are you referring to?"

Animals talking, walking on two legs, and at least one of them is even taking on human form.\n\nMy theory is that Angry Earth's infected them with lycanthropy - we have ourselves a legitimate werewolf!
"It changes from human to wolf?"

More like wolf to human, and frankly, becoming human's driven the wolf mad, rabid.\n\nFangsnap is the name of the beast, and it's slain several travelers out toward the coast. I don't know what to do.
"Hunt it down?"
Aye, it's the only choice we have, it seems. I tried, but the beast got the better of me.\n\nIf you're the hunting type, keep a lookout for Fangsnap, and if you find it, destroy it fast.
Defeat Fangsnap in {POITags}
Defeat Fangsnap
If my suspicions are correct and animals really are taking on human form, things are gonna change.\n\nWe humans might soon go from being predators to being prey.

You did it then? You hunted down the monstrous beast, Fangsnap? \n\nI'm guessing he didn't take on his human form, but I swear it's true. I've seen the tracks. Either way, the damn thing needed to be destroyed.
Pirates Will Pirate
Defeat Neptunite Pirates and collect Pirate Booty from chests for Constable Muller in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"What do you mean?"
Rilette Wilson's claiming there's a werewolf stalking the shore, and others say the Lost have gone to war.\n\nThe soulless, aimless Lost fighting each other - it makes no sense. I don't buy it.
"Stranger things have happened."
Oh, don't you start in on me, too. Sure, the Lost Buccaneers have been raiding, but that's what they did in life - typical Lost behavior.\n\nI think once we get our stuff back this'll blow over.
"Is that something I can help with?"

Why yes. About time someone wants to get to the solution. The Buccaneers are out at the wreck of the Neptune's Fury.\n\nGive the bloated fiends a taste of their own medicine - raid them, and steal THEIR booty.
Defeat Neptunite Pirates and collect Pirate Booty at {POITags}
Defeat Neptunite Pirates
Collect {ItemName} from Chests
I mean, how long have the Lost pirates of Aeternum been raiding the supplies of the living?\n\nIt's normal Lost pirate behavior, nothing more.
Haha! You gave those damn buccaneers a little payback, didn't you? Let's see the spoils!\n\nPerfect! This should make everyone happy, get things back to normal. Thank you, {playerName}.
War of the Lost
Defeat Seele's Withered at the Decayed Campsite for Magistrate Gurkin in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"They're fighting each other?"

Indeed. The Lost Buccaneers have been fighting the Withered and vice versa.\n\nTo see the Lost with such focus and intention is disturbing, and the worst part is that Constable Muller won't even acknowledge it!
"Why not?"

The woman is in denial, I tell you. She prefers to believe that everything is normal, well, as normal as it gets.\n\nWe have no time to convince her, however. We need to maintain the balance out there.
"Why not let them destroy each other?"

Because the victor will turn on us, and we can't have that.\n\nRight now, the Withered have the upper hand. If you'll destroy as many as you can, I'll see you well-rewarded, {playerName}. You have my word.
Survey the situation at {POITags}
Destroy Seele's {targetName}
Destroy Seele's {targetName}
I tell you - I've fought them myself - I've seen the look in their eyes and the way it's changed.\n\nThe Lost are finding some sense of purpose, and we need to prevent that.
You've seen for yourself now, haven't you? They fight with increased ferocity, with more precision, with purpose.\n\nStriking a blow to the Withered was the perfect thing. Thank you.
The Greater Threat
Kill Eastshore Forces at the Eastshore Pier and Gather Fishing Supplies for Magistrate Gurkin in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"The Lost are fishing?"
Yes! You get it, right? It sounds harmless in a way, but it's further evidence that they are more and more sentient.\n\nI swear by the Ancients, this is the most terrifying thing I have heard yet.
"What should we do?"
We need to fight them while they are weak, and discourage them from advancement.\n\nEastshore Pier, that's the place. Go and strike down the soggy bastards... and confiscate their fishing supplies.
Exhaust Eastshore forces and supplies at {POITags}
Defeat Eastshore Forces
Collect {ItemName} from Chests
There was a time I used to fish from the Eastshore Pier myself.\n\nThat was back before it fell to the Lost in the first place.
Hah! No more fishing for the Lost! That should stop them from getting ideas.\n\nI just hope it's enough. Artificer Taethen and I are still trying to get Constable Muller to come around.
Disarmament (Elite)
Confiscate grenades from chests and destroy Ching Shih the Shark for Artificer Taethen in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"What kind of work?"
Those blasted Lost Buccaneers are arming themselves, even developing new weapons.\n\nIt's unheard of for the Lost, and we need to disarm the soulless bastards before it catches on.
"Where are their weapons?"
They're stockpiling grenades at an old wreck known as the Minnow's Revenge.\n\nChing Shih the Shark is their ringleader - take him down and confiscate the grenades and that'll put an end to it.
Defeat and pilfer from Lost Buccaneers at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {ItemName} from Chests
Watch yourself out there. Rumor says the pirates' grenades are enhanced with azoth.\n\nNever thought I'd see the day.

Took down Ching Shih the shark, did you? And you got the grenades? Well done, {playerName}.\n\nThat'll cut a hole in their sails, I tell you. Let's hope the Lost Pirate forget all about their ambitions.
Slaying the Shadowslayer
Kill Erika the Shadowslayer in Solitude Cemetery for Artificer Taethen in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"The Withered have the edge?"

Exactly. With the Pirates pushed back, the Withered are now on the offensive.\n\nIt's their leader we need to deal with - the Shadowslayer - she's been a dark threat here for decades, and even darker now.
"Where is the Shadowslayer?"

You'll find her in Solitude Cemetery, but be careful, she's made many Lost from those who crossed her path. \n\nWhen you've done that, I'd ask you to take a shot at convincing Muller of what we're up against.
Put an end to the story of the Shadowslayer at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Destroy the Shadowslayer, {playerName}, whatever it takes.\n\nThen go and try to convince the Constable to finally acknowledge our plight.

So you went out and dealt with the Shadowslayer? It's about time someone did that.\n\nI know you've been working with Gurkin too, but come on, you aren't buying into this idea of the Lost being more advanced, are you?
"It does seem to be true."
Dammit, I was afraid you'd say that! Why can't the Corrupted just stay up at the mountain and the Lost stay lost?\n\nDon't even get me started about the Angry Earth - Wilson's about driven me insane.
Where The Boars Roam
Defeat Boars and Tuskgore at Boarsholm for Survivalist Wilson in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"Are you sure about that"
I am quite certain that the boar in question is responsible for slaying a traveler to the north. \n\nEven more concerning - I've come to believe that this lycanthropy is contagious, too.
"You think we could catch it?"
No, but I think it can spread among the wildlife. We just get the were-boar and any boars who've had contact.\n\nTuskgore is the beastly creature's name. Destroy it, and any other boars nearby.
Purge Boars at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}s
Defeat {targetName}
If we let this strange new mutation from the Angry Earth spread, our days our numbered.\n\nDestroy Tuskgore, for the safety and security of everyone on Aeternum.
The deed's done then? Tuskgore is no more? That is a big relief.\n\nThat boar was a monster and if my theory about Lycanthropy is true, the danger was even greater still.
Scouting Report
Destroy Channelview Pirates in Channelview Post and Oceanview Pirates in Oceanview Post and look for anything suspicious. Then report back to Constable Muller in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"What's Fort Damnation?"
That's the fort up on the hill. Once upon a time, that's where the region was governed from.\n\nA naval force from the Arabian Sea reigned supreme - then they all became Lost.
"And what's going on there now?"

Nothing, we hope, but maybe you should check it out. Steer clear of the Fort itself - let's not stir things up.\n\nConfront the Lost in the east and west lookout camps and see if there's anything suspicious.
Vanquish Lost Pirates at {POITags}
Defeat Channelview Pirates for {ItemName}
Vanquish Lost Pirates at {POITags}
Defeat Oceanview Pirates for {ItemName}
The more I think about this, the more I start to worry.\n\nMaybe I should've listened to Gurkin from the start.
Thank the stars you're back! What did you find? Runestones... what the heck?\n\nMaybe it's some kind of Ancient magic that's giving the bastards this renewed sense of purpose?
Damnation's Fall
Defeat Admiral Reis in the center ship of Fort Damnation. Then report back to Constable Muller in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"Maybe we should attack."

Launch a frontal attack on Fort Damnation? Are you out of your mind? \n\nWait, don't answer that. Here's the thing, it's not the fort itself that's the problem, it's the fort's commander, Admiral Reis.
"Who's Admiral Reis?"

Probably one of the most dangerous fleet commanders of all history - literally thousands killed in his name.\n\nIf you're going up there, you gotta get the Admiral to make it count. Oh, and take friends - you'll need them.
Take down Admiral Reis at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
I'll give you this much - you've already proven to have the strength to back up your bravado - but if you're going to take on Admiral Reis, you'd best be prepared.

Well, I thought I'd see the sun rise in the west before I saw anyone take down Admiral Reis.\n\nI gotta hand it to you - you are a force to be reckoned with. I think it only fitting you receive a proper reward.
Paying Respects
Travel to Mourningdale and convey Barkeep Andris's respects to Barkeep Brewell.
"What happened?"
The Watcher there, Guerra - he fell to the Lost. Quite a hero, I understand.\n\nIn fact, if you pass through Mourningdale, please offer my condolences to Barkeep Brewell. We go back a ways.
The news from Mourningdale is tragic, indeed.\n\nIt almost make me feel guilty that things are going so well here.
Come and sit down and have a drink on the house, traveler.\n\nWe all mourn the passing of a hero today - Watcher Guerra - did you know of him?
"Yes, Andris offers her condolences."
Ah, old Andris is still keeping bar out there. Good for her.\n\nKind of you both, of course, but it is our Magistrate for whom we should all feel bad. She is quite beside herself.
Archdeacon Azamela (Expedition)
Collect the head of Archdeacon Azamela in The Depths for Magistrate Gurkin.
"Is there another threat?"
You’re damn right, there is! The Corrupted! The Shattered Mountain? \n\nJust when we thought we'd earned a reprieve, now the Corrupted have a foothold, right here in Restless Shore.
"Then we'll drive them out."

Coming from you, I believe it. They're in a place called "The Depths."\n\nA Corrupted Warlord's taken charge there, but the architect is called Archdeacon Azamela. Destroy the bastard, and I'll heap rewards on you.
Who knows what darkness this Archdeacon Azamela is cooking up in the Depths.\n\nAs you said, they must be driven out of Restless Shore, and kept out.
Is that it? You destroyed the Archdeacon, didn't you? There's another blow for righteousness and the good of humanity!\n\nWell done, {playerName}, and as promised, here is your reward.
Defeat the architect of {POITags} within its halls
Defeat Archdeacon Azamela
Defeat Archdeacon Azamela and Collect His Head
Hoppy Trails
Visit Rabbit Island and if you can find any signs of a curse then deal with them and then return to Survivalist Wilson in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"Did you have another request?"

This request is a bit more... unconventional. There is a small island nearby I would like you to investigate. \n\nRabbit Island is a great source of meat and fur but recently the hunters of the settlement have been avoiding it, claiming it to be cursed.
"Cursed?"
I don't know how a bunch of bunnies like friendly ole Stanley could be cursed, but many now refuse to visit. \n\nGo to Rabbit Island and see what all this fuss is about, would you?
Investigate {POITags} for a haunting
Defeat Stanley
Defeat The Harekeeper

A man used to live on that island all by his lonesome, kept to himself and his rabbits well enough. Perhaps you could ask him about the rumors of a haunting of the island and see what he makes of all of this?

So the Harekeeper passed on? I'm glad you put him to rest. His furry friends will flourish with or without him, I suspect. \n\nBut I imagine they'll miss their kindly caretaker. Maybe I'll miss the Harekeep a little myself, as well.
Meat For Nekumanesh (Expedition)
Collect Hunks of Meat for Nekumanesh the alligator from Corrupted Leaders in The Depths Expedition.
"Wow, so small…"
(The alligator snaps at you, clearly offended by the insinuation that he isn't big enough.)
"Maybe I can help you get bigger."
(Nekumanesh pants like a dog and licks his sharp teeth. Who could have left him here?)
(Nekumanesh looks at you suspiciously. He had been expecting you to return with food.)
(With a hearty snap of his jaws, Nekumanesh eats up all the meat you gave him like he'd been starving. Did he just get a little bigger…?)
Venture into the Depths Expedition for Nekumanesh
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
Defeat Archdeacon Azamela and collect {itemName}
The First Thing I Remember
Discover Santiago Salazar's past by confronting members of his former crew and tracking down a ship manifest and their journal entries.
"You don’t remember anything?"

I have flashes of a ship voyage, but that doesn’t say much. Who here hasn't arrived by boat? But there's more... \n\nThe answers I need lie on that island across the channel. Without answers, I fear I may slip away…
"Do you mean you'll become Lost?"

Gasp! I feel the cold even now... 

Cross! Yes, that was the captain's name! Her crew manifest may have the answers I seek. 

But be wary! For Cross succumbed to the deathless despair that seeks me. Good luck!
I appreciate your help. I'd forget my own head if it wasn’t attached. \n\nWhat was I was looking for? My name on a manifest, right?
You're back! I feared you’d end up a soulless Withered, wandering the beaches like old Captain Cross. \n\nBut you seem troubled. What did you discover?
"You were not part of Captain Cross’s crew."
Hmm, that's odd. Who did I sail under then? More unanswered questions... \n\nAt least we've removed those ships as possibilities. I can focus my search on a new area.
Travel to {POITags} to defeat Santiago's former crewmates
Collect {itemName} from a {targetName}
Tell Santiago what you have discovered
Travel to {POITags} to defeat Santiago's former crewmates
Defeat {targetName}
Search for 'The Great Port Heist'
Search for 'Captain's Orders'
Footsteps on the Beach
Retrace Santiago Salazars steps to find what he placed in a chest and recover Rosario's Manifest from one of his previous crewmembers.
"I suppose it's understandable given your condition."

You’re too kind. But I’m certain the answer lies on these shores. 

At the bar in the settlement, I heard from Niki Andris that I sailed on the Rosario. That feels right. 

Now I recall I lost something precious there.
"Precious?"

Aye, gifts from loved ones. Pieces of jewelry, I think. A ring or perhaps a necklace? \n\nAlthough I was mistaken before, I'm certain I was a member of the Rosario’s crew. Would you help me recover these priceless mementos?
When I think of all my precious keepsakes scattered on these shores, I wonder what more I’m missing? \n\nWere they earrings? A bracelet? I'm eager to see what you find.
You’ve returned! And look at that! You found my missing jewelry! That ring! That brooch! And how could I forget that solid gold locket!
"None of these keepsakes have your name on it."

Salvator's a nickname, you see. Alice was... my wife. Oh and my dear daughter Gemma gave me this brooch for safe keeping. I’ll never forget it. \n\nAh, how these mementos draw me back from the brink of despair!
Travel to {POITags} to find items from Santiago's past
Recover {itemName} from a chest
Recover {itemName} from a Pirate
Recover {itemName} from a Pirate
The True Terror of the Seas
Confront Santiago Salazar's previous captain Scurvyhook, and extract revenge to put Santiago's mind at ease.
"What villain did this to you?"
He now goes by Scurvyhook. Never was there a captain more cruel! \n\nManaged to kill a crew member every day we were at sea. Not to mention taking all our fine cargo for himself!
"Sounds like an evil bastard."
He was! Is! And now you can help me set things right! \n\nGive our poor crew the justice they deserve! Teach Scurvyhook that wickedness has a price!
I finally understand why I tried so hard to forget my past. \n\nHelp me lay my personal demons to rest by taking on Scurvyhook. His reign of terror must end!
Is the deed done? Have you destroyed those bilge rats and their vile captain? Has Scurvyhook been sent to the abyss?
"Scurvyhook has answered for his crimes."
Ah, there’s no greater salve for the mind than the peace that comes from finally getting revenge… That is to say, justice. \n\nAnd Scurvyhook's demise has jogged even more memories.
Travel to {POITags} to find Scurvyhook
Defeat Scurvyhook
A Pirate's Life
Follow a trail of Doubloons to reclaim the treasure Santiago's old crew had stashed away years ago.
"Wait, you said you were merchants."

Oh, right. We were merchants. But we took what we were owed! The crew hid Scurvyhook’s prized golden stash as payment for our suffering. \n\nIf you find it, I can guarantee a cut. We’ll split it three ways, Niki, you, and me.
"How much treasure are we talking about?"

Now that's the attitude! Plenty, but I need your keen mind to find where the treasure is located. \n\nI remember the crew left a trail of doubloons, starting in Cutthroat Cavern. Follow the gold and you can’t go astray!
There's more to life than mourning what was lost. \n\nThat treasure should help set me on a new path, making up for years of wandering this blasted beach.
You look like you need a drink. Hoodwinked by Salazar, were you? You weren't the first, and won't be the last. \n\nDid he give you the whole 'woe is me, I'm becoming Lost' tale?
"Uses that one a lot, does he?"
That one seems to get the best results. Makes you feel like you’re helping someone, you know? \n\nAt least you returned, most who are tricked by him don’t. Sadly, men like him never stay down long.
Discover Doubloons at {POITags}
Follow the trail of Doubloons
Discover Doubloons at {POITags}
Discover Doubloons at the {POITags}
Recover Santiago's treasure
Defeat Santiago
Broken Communication
Recover Myrtilus's Bow from the Angry Earth at Pisces.
"What's different about them?"

Aside from one who is blind to the land talking with us? The seasons are amiss in Verdant Ascent. \n\nThis is not widely known, but we have lost contact with our brethren in Edengrove. It is troubling.
"Perhaps I can help discover the reason."
No! Outsiders are not welcome in our affairs. \n\nNo, we need help with a matter closer to the taproot. In our haste to travel to Edengrove, our bow was left behind. And we cannot go back for it.

Our bow was left where the fish swim across the sky. \n\nIt is likely one of our siblings picked it up, if only to prevent us from leaving so easily. They were against us sprouting out on our own. Please return our bow.

Impressive! We did not expect much. All you did at first was stare. \n\nOh, you’re still staring. Are you not aware that different petals may grow from the same plant? So too do different plants serve different purposes.
"I’m not sure I understand."

It would be easier if you were part of our mind. \n\nStill, we thank you for aiding us. While our minds are divided, it is best for the branch to remain separate from the tree, however difficult. Their reproach is strong.
Travel to {POITags} to recover Myrtilus's Bow
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Spined Ammunition
Recover Myrtilus's Quiver and Thornpoint Arrows from the Angry Earth at Fornax.
"They would prevent you from leaving?"

If we returned, it would be like an early winter frost. There would be long discourses about the merits of staying secure at Eridanus. \n\nWhich would be as good as never leaving at all. We cannot sit by and allow that.
"Then why haven’t you left yet?"

That is the heartwood of the matter. While we are most appreciative to have our bow back, it is like a spiny branch stripped of its thorns. \n\nWe remember leaving a quiver behind at Fornax. Please return our arrows to us.
The Thornpoint arrows were made specifically for use with this bow. Like a layer of strong bark, they protect against all sorts of dangers on the road. \n\nWe cannot leave without our arrows.

Once again you do not disappoint. These arrows shall do nicely. \n\nNow we are adequately protected against any dangers that would endeavor to stop us along the road. If only all humans were this helpful.
"Perhaps you haven’t met the right people."

Perhaps. We are rather isolated in Eridanus. We are insular, perhaps too insular. \n\nWhen we return from our journey, we should discuss opening our borders more often. Different perspectives may do us some good.
Travel to {POITags} to recover Myrilus's Quiver and Thornpoint Arrows
Find Myrtilus's Quiver at {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Trail Rations
Recover Nutrient Stalks from containers at Eridanus for Myrtilus.
"What do you eat?"

When times are good, a pleasant rain and warm sunlight is enough. \n\nBut in times of high stress, and indeed when we sustain heavy damage, we require more than what the earth can provide to set things right and speed our healing.
"Can’t you get that from the ground?"

We hear of Corruption spreading like strangling ivy. We cannot count on the earth providing us with what we need. \n\nWe can take no chances, not when the soil could be contaminated. Please bring us nutrient stalks.
It is best to rely on sustenance untouched by foulness. \n\nPlease bring us the nourishment we need to begin our journey.

We can smell the freshness of the nutrient stalks from here. We relish the chance to have a taste while on the road. \n\nThere is nothing quite like the taste of home to restore all balance and mend all ills.
"What's in them?"

An ancestral recipe of spring and fall. One we do not share with outsiders. If humans knew what was in them, they would figure out how to contaminate them. \n\nWe are sorry, but we cannot take that risk.
Travel to {POITags} to collect Nutrient Stalks for Myrtilus
Collect {itemName} from chests
Unnatural Habitation
Search Clawpoint Ruins for any clues as to why there are lynx in the area.
"It's not like we can just leave."
True. We're trapped on this island. Just like those poor lynx. \n\nYou know, someone brought those animals into Restless Shore. They aren’t native to this part of the island.
"Where do they belong?"

Snow-filled forests, not ruins. There are clues at Clawpoint Ruins. Would you search them for me? \n\nI have a lead I need to follow before it grows cold. There's a camp of poachers not too far from here.
The clues are out there, I know it. \n\nI can feel the answer is at Clawpoint Ruins. Search the ruins and let me know what you discover.
Let me guess – you found cages, didn’t you?
"Along with food and restraints."
The damn poachers did this. I found them at their camp. But I feel like I missed something. \n\nThey were messing with more than just lynx, I'm sure of it.
Travel to {POITags} to find clues about the lynx
Search for lynx cages
Search for lynx bait
Search for lynx restraints
A Hair's Breadth from Danger
Search the poacher's camp for any letters about their activities.
"What more needs to be found?"

When I visited the poachers camp, I was able to get answers to some of my questions, but it was clear there was more to their plans. \n\nI didn't find all their notes. I'm sure there is more information hidden around their camp.
I need more information about what those poachers were doing. The lynx were just the smallest part of their plan. \n\nI'll stay here and keep watch on the ruins, in case those poachers track me down.
Something has changed. Don’t tell me they've returned! \n\nBlast it, I should have burned that place to the ground when I had the chance!
"I found these letters about their plans for the wolves."
This was what I missed! \n\nGood lord! They've been feeding the wolves dangerous concoctions! They've infected them! How could they do such a thing?
Travel to the poacher's camp to discover their plans
Search for 'Geoff's First Letter'
Search for 'Geoff's Second Letter'
Search for 'Geoff's Third Letter'
Rule of Tooth and Claw
Right the wrongs done to the local wolf pack.
"Is there anything we can do?"
Our choices are limited. The damage has been done. And we don't have anything that can counter what they did. \n\nIt's a hard choice, but I think the only humane thing is to put the wolves down.
"Is there really no other way?"
None that I know. Perhaps in the future, we could find a way to counter the effect. \n\nBut now there's no time. We have to act fast, before the wolves travel and infect other dens.
You go on ahead, I'll be right behind you. \n\nThe wolf cave isn't that far away, you can't miss it.

So, you met the mad Caryn Berzs. She’s an odd one, I’ll give you that. 

She’s wanted for freeing the local dogs. Said we were monsters for locking them up. 

I bet she expects us to pay you for your work.
"Where is she now?"

Off raising hell no doubt. She’s as slippery as an eel, clever as a fox, and mad as a badger. I’m sure we’ll get word of her next exploits soon enough. \n\nStill, we appreciate what you did with the wolves.
Travel to {POITags} to put down the tainted wolves
Defeat {targetName}
Search for Caryn's Note
Fisherman's Allure
Search for treasure at Poseidon's Plunder for Wafa Keles.
"What's holding you back?"
What do I have to offer? I’m good at spearfishing. And few can climb sea-slick rocks as well as I can. \n\nBut I'm not rich. I have nothing that would interest Xue.
"What would interest Xue?"
He’s only in Restless Shore to find some treasure. Maybe if I had some, he’d be interested in me. \n\nI’ve heard there's treasure in the wreck of Poseidon’s Plunder. Would you help me recover it?
I don't have much, but what I do have I'm willing to share with Xue Tian. \n\nPlease recover the treasure from Poseidon's Plunder so I can give it to Xue.

Is that what you found? Impressive! Xue will be thrilled to see this! \n\nYou know, he’s afraid of the water. He puts on a brave face about it, but that’s why he won’t go out to the submerged shipwrecks.
"You could help him search for treasure."
I hadn’t thought of that! I love the ocean, the sound of the waves. \n\nI could search the water for treasures while he stayed on shore. We’d make the perfect team!
Search the chest as {POITags} for treasure
Recover Poseidon's Goblet from the chest
Treasured Company
Bring a letter from Wafa Keles to Xue Tien
"You could ask him to appraise it."

Yes! I could say I found this goblet, and ask him to take a look. I like it! 

But I’m so nervous! Just the thought of talking to him makes me weak-kneed. 

Could you take him a message asking him to check it out?
"Is that all you want to say?"
Yes! No! There is so much I could say. But I don’t want to scare him away! \n\nJust give him a message about Poseidon’s Goblet. That will be enough for now. Or so I hope.
I know I’ll have to talk to Xue on my own someday… but could you ask him to stop by for me? \n\nTell him about Poseidon’s Goblet and see if he is interested in a business partnership.
A message from Wafa Keles asking me to appraise something called Poseidon’s Goblet? Sounds intriguing… \n\nBut I must ask – are they still standing out in the water?
"Yes, they’re still wading offshore."
They’re so brave to face the terrors of the ocean like that. I’ve seen many a man lost to the dangerous riptides. \n\nI can’t believe they’re so calm about standing in the sea.
Not Another Fish in the Sea
Recover Xue's Sea Glass Charms from the Treetop pirates that stole them.
"So what brings you out here?"
I needed some space. And had to get away from my overbearing family. \n\nI came here to find peace of mind. Then I saw Wafa, and I knew I found what I'd been looking for.
"Wafa Keles? They adore you."

They do? I thought they... Oh! They thought I’d only be interested if they had treasure! I need to get them a gift to show that’s not true. \n\nI made some Sea Glass Charms to protect against the sea, but pirates stole them.
Those Treetop pirates stole my Sea Glass Charms. \n\nThey would be a perfect gift for Wafa. Please get them back.
Those are perfect! \n\nCan you imagine them hanging from their hair, catching the sunlight as they dance through the waves?
"They’ll look great."
What about me? Do you think I’m properly dressed? \n\nI don’t know what I should wear for a meeting like this. It’s all so exciting. I hope they like the charms.
Travel to {POITags} to recover Xue's Sea Glass Charms
